etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin caesius ‘grayish-blue’ (because it has characteristic lines in the blue part of the spectrum)

definitions: the chemical element of atomic number 55, a soft, silvery, extremely reactive metal. It belongs to the alkali metal group and occurs as a trace element in some rocks and minerals.
shortDefinitions: chemical element of atomic number 55, soft, silvery, extremely reactive metal
